p.s:
Antonio d'Enrico , called
Tanzio da Varallo
, or simply
il Tanzio
[ 1 ]
( c. 1575/1580 – c. 1632/1633 ) was an Italian painter of the late-
Mannerist
or early
Baroque
period .

He was born in
Riale d’Alagna
, and was active mainly in
Lombardy
and
Piedmont
, including the
Sacro Monte
at
Varallo Sesia
, where he worked contemporaneously with
Pier Francesco Mazzucchelli ( il Morazzone )
.

He painted a
Circumcision
for
Fara San Martino
, and a
Virgin with saints
for the Collegiate at
Pescocostanzo
.

Some of his paintings acquire the influence of
Tenebrist
styles and morbid thematic characteristic of the followers of
Caravaggio
and also of many
Lombard
painters , including his somewhat gruesome
David with Goliath
( 1620 ) .

His animated and crowded
Battle of Sennacherib
( 1627 – 28 ) for the
Basilica of San Gaudenzio
[ 2 ]
reflects the influence of his work in the
Sacri Monti of Piedmont and Lombardy
, painting scenographic diorama scenes .

His brother Melchiorre was also a painter , studied in Milan , and painted a last judgement for the parish of Riva .
[ 3 ]
